result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob L Shockto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob L Shockto is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jacob L Shockto was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Jacob L Shockto was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Jacob L Shockto was found guilty of Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

Defendant must obtain his GED.

The defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter into any bars/taverns.
The defendant must undergo an anger management assesstment and follow thru with all recommendations.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
All other conditions the same as count 3 with no additional community service.
Concurrent with: Count 3

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob L Shockto

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jacob L Shockto in court/custody with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:20 AM. Called 15CF138, 15CM101, 15CM126, 15CM202, 15CM203, 15TR644, 15TR643 & 15TR645 

15CM101: Count 1 - State amends to FC ordinance of DC w/MV - $1000 plus costs. Shockto pleads G. Court accepts plea and imposes fine of $1000 plus costs, 60 DTP/CO. Court dismisses count 2

15CM126: Count 1 - State amends to FC ordinance of DC. Count 2 - Dismissed, Counts 3-4 18 months probation, court costs, AODA and follow through, anger management assesment, no consumption or possession of alcohol. No entry into bars or taverns, maintain FT employment/schooling, 125 hours of Community Service. Court amends count 1 to FC ordinance of disorderly conduct. Shocto pleads guilty to count 1 as amended, court imposes fine of $300 plus costs. Take bond posted. Court dismisses count 2. Shockto pleads guilty to counts 3 & 4. Court goes over plea questionaire with defendant and finds the defendant is freely, voluntarily and inteligently entering his plea and right to trial. Court accepts plea and adjudges guilty. State asks to follow joint recommendation and makes final statement. Joy also asks to follow recommendation and makes final statement. Shockto with holds comment. Court has considered all statement from each party and sentences to the following: Counts 3 & 4 - With hold sentence and place on probation for 18 months, court costs take from money posted, AODA and follow through, anger management program and follow through with recommendations, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into bars or taverns, maintain FT employment/schooling, 125 hours of community service, must obtain GED. Right to appeal, submit DNA sample. Take all money posted on each case.

15CM203, 15CM202 and 15CF138 - Joy has complaint waives further reading, waives time limints on felony case and not guility to all misdemeanor counts. All bonds continued.

 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob L Shockto
Current: P.O.Box 431, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 10-26-2015)
Prior: 7591 Potawatomi Trail, Crandon, WI 54520

Defendant Jacob L Shockto in court with attorney Jeffery Joy who appears telephonically.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:42 AM. Also called 15CM101. Court reads charges and penalties for both complaints. Shockto and Joy understand all charges and penalties. Joy waives further reading on each case, pleads NG to all counts on both cases and set both matters for FPT. State - bond - 15CM126 - modify bond to $2950.00 with understanding that $1350 is still ordered forfeited and on 15CM101 - $1500.00 that is posted with understanding that $1200.00 is still ordered forfeited. Joy - bond - no objections to bond as stated by DA. Court questions defendant in regards to setting bond at monies posted - bond - 15CM126 - $2950.00 cash that is already posted with no contact with Adam Short and 15CM101 - $1500.00 that is already posted. Joy enters NG pleas to traffic matters that are currently set on 10/28/15 and track with criminal matters. Shockto does not need to return on 10/28/15 for those matters.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance at 10-14-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Jacob L Shockto not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 9:17 a.m. Also called 15CM126. State has mailed S&C to last known address. Court forfeits any bond posted and issues bench warrant, body or $1600.00 on 15CM126 and continues warrant on 15CM101.
Bonded prior to PC being set
